title: wine_Carabella_2012_Inchinnan_Pinot_Noir_(Chehalem_Mountains)
text:
Unnamed: 0: 65773.
country: US.
description: Inchinnan, the winery explains, is a Scottish word that means some little special place. Special indeed is this fruit, a three-clone estate vineyard selection. Blackberry and black cherry dappled with cinnamon is at the heart of it, supported with balanced natural acidity. A bit darker in color and flavor than the estate bottling, it's immediately enjoyable and structured for medium-term cellaring..
designation: Inchinnan.
points: 92.
price: 54.0.
province: Oregon.
region_1: Chehalem Mountains.
region_2: Willamette Valley.
taster_name: Paul Gregutt.
